metadata.title: Is Coding Creation or Pattern Assembly?

The Grammar Ops framework suggests we've been thinking about code wrong. It's not about creating - it's about configuring pre-existing patterns.

AI just makes this truth more obvious.

Think about it: When you write a React component, are you "creating" or just assembling patterns?

It's LEGO blocks, not sculpting.

Grammar Ops takes this further: What if your entire codebase was a Domain Specific Language (DSL) that AI could understand perfectly?

No more "prompt engineering" - just speak the language of your system.

The future: "Infrastructure as Grammar"

Imagine converting natural language directly to production code because your codebase follows consistent, predictable patterns.

That's not sci-fi. That's what Grammar Ops enables today.

Plot twist: In this world, humans become the prompt interface to AI.

We're not replaced - we're elevated to system designers who speak intentions rather than syntax.

The machines handle the implementation details.
